BackstoryDef.title: Mysterious Stranger
BackstoryDef.description: You have a Guardian Angel, but with a deadly hand-cannon instead of wings. Meet the Mysterious Stranger, an odd and eldritch entity said to appear and aid you in combat before you draw your dying breath.

BackstoryDef.title: Wandering Ranger
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was part of the elite fighting force that joined the NCR, the Desert Rangers. [PAWN_pronoun] excels in ranged combat and has quite a few other survival skills, owed to years of service in and around the wasteland. [PAWN_nameDef] hasn't always made the smartest choices, but always seems to talk [PAWN_possessive] way out of trouble. With a revolver and a smolder [PAWN_nameDef] wanders the wastes looking for the next settlement to help, and accidently bring into harms way...

BackstoryDef.title: Crystal Sparkle
BackstoryDef.description: Crystal Sparkle was born in pre-war China and immigrated to America with dreams of becoming a doctor. She was studying medicine and performing as an amateur magician when the Great War began, and the bombs turned her world to ash. Exposed to extreme radiation, she became a glowing one, her body forever changed but her mind intact. Despite her ghoulified state, Crystal dedicated herself to helping others in the wasteland, using her medical knowledge and sleight-of-hand tricks to bring hope and wonder to those in need. She met Ranger Rick after patching him up from a deadly ambush, and the two have been inseparable ever since. Her glowing aura is both a beacon of hope and a danger in the unforgiving wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Armor and Apparel Trader
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] makes [PAWN_possessive] living by selling apparel, clothing and armor to the people of the wastes. Having grown up and lived as a tribal before giving up the "loincloth" [PAWN_nameDef] speaks in a broken almost mystic version of enlgish. While [PAWN_pronoun] likes to thank the spirits, [PAWN_pronoun] knows that "a cold, hard skin of steel" is the most reliable option.

BackstoryDef.title: Crows' Childhood
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a born tribal of the Capitol Wasteland. Not much is known about [PAWN_nameDef] except a wild speculation that [PAWN_pronoun] is from Oasis. A small unassuming and quite curious settlement of near fanatical cultists.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Farmer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a farmer. Not many crops grew in the barren, often irradiated, soil of the wasteland, but [PAWN_pronoun] managed to scrape by. Sadly, [PAWN_nameDef] never got a proper education and remained illiterate.

BackstoryDef.title: Sawbones
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was educated in medicine by the Followers of the Apocalypse. Albeit [PAWN_pronoun] never became as skilled a doctor as [PAWN_possessive] tutors, [PAWN_pronoun] knew enough about human anatomy to become a wandering sawbones.

BackstoryDef.title: Moonshiner
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] has always had a talent for chemistry and decided to put it to good use by making booze. Life in the wasteland is tough and many of its inhabitants need an occasional pick-me-up and [PAWN_nameDef] was willing to provide it… as long as they paid in caps.

BackstoryDef.title: Slaver
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a slaver, buying and selling other human beings for profit. While [PAWN_pronoun] managed to become quite wealthy through [PAWN_possessive] trade, [PAWN_pronoun] got used to slaves doing all the menial labor.

BackstoryDef.title: Caravaneer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] has seen more of the wasteland than most of its inhabitants, since [PAWN_pronoun] travelled around with a caravan outfit. On the roads of the wasteland [PAWN_pronoun] learned a lot about trading and generally interacting with people, as well as how to tend to the beasts of burden carrying the valuable goods.

BackstoryDef.title: Weapon Artisan
BackstoryDef.description: The hostility of the wasteland and many of its inhabitants, both beasts and humans, make the ability to craft and maintain weaponry indispensable. [PAWN_nameDef] has this gift and used it to look after the equipment of [PAWN_possessive] community.

BackstoryDef.title: Water Merchant
BackstoryDef.description: As much of the wasteland is arid and irradiated, clean water is a precious commodity. [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a merchant specialized in trading water, transporting it from its source to the thirsty settlements of the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Roving Trader
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was roving trader, moving from place to place, never staying long. [PAWN_pronoun] has a way with people and learned some other survival skills while being on the road.

BackstoryDef.title: Caravan Guard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] made a living protecting the caravans of the wasteland. Without the occasional caravan, many settlements in the wasteland couldn’t survive and it was [PAWN_possessive]’s job to make sure they reached their destination.

BackstoryDef.title: Small Time Mercenary
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a small-time mercenary. [PAWN_pronoun] never quite made it to the big league but was nevertheless a capable fighter. [PAWN_pronoun] never lived long in one place, lacking the skills of a homemaker.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Artist
BackstoryDef.description: Unusual for an inhabitant of the wasteland, [PAWN_nameDef] always had an eye for aesthetics. While most other wastelanders didn’t mind living in ruined pre-war buildings, [PAWN_nameDef] preferred to decorate [PAWN_possessive] dwelling with pieces of art, either self-made or scavenged ones.

BackstoryDef.title: Settlement Guard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a guard in a small, independent settlement. While [PAWN_pronoun] rarely had to deal with bigger threats, there were always dangerous animals which ventured to close to the town and had to be put down.

BackstoryDef.title: Courier
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a courier for the Mojave Express, or a similar delivery company. To overcome the many dangers of the postapocalyptic wasteland, couriers had to be resilient individuals, capable of putting up a fight against raiders. Furthermore, [PAWN_nameDef] had a set of other survival skills, owed to the fact that [PAWN_pronoun] often lived alone on the road for many weeks.

BackstoryDef.title: Gecko Hunter
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] made a living by hunting Geckos and other smaller animals of the wasteland for their meat and hides. [PAWN_pronoun] is not only a good hunter but also knows how to maintain [PAWN_possessive] equipment.

BackstoryDef.title: Sheriff
BackstoryDef.description: As [PAWN_pronoun] was always handy with a gun and had a strong sense of justice, the inhabitants of [PAWN_nameDef]’s settlement elected [PAWN_possessive] as the town’s sheriff. Much of the wasteland lacked an organised judicial system but [PAWN_nameDef] was content with enforcing some good old frontier justice.

BackstoryDef.title: Prospector
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a scavenger, picking through the remains of pre-war buildings for valuables. It was a hard life and [PAWN_nameDef] had to learn how to fight, as feral ghouls and raiders often lived in the ruins [PAWN_pronoun] searched through.

BackstoryDef.title: Freed Slave
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] once was a slave, liberated by an abolitionist group somewhere in the wasteland. Although [PAWN_nameDef] regained [PAWN_possessive] freedom, enslavement left its marks and made [PAWN_pronoun] unable to enact violence upon others.

BackstoryDef.title: Nuka Cola Fan
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] always had a fascination for the world-famous pre-war soft drink Nuka-Cola. [PAWN_pronoun] collected everything related to Nuka-Cola and quickly amassed an impressive amount of fan articles and souvenirs.

BackstoryDef.title: Tinkerer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] has had a talent with machinery, both primitive and complex, and managed to repair and maintain it despite often not knowing how exactly it functioned. This made [PAWN_objective] an important member of [PAWN_possessive] community, as trained experts were a rare sight in the wasteland. However, [PAWN_pronoun] was also known as untidy, taking apart machines and leaving the party lying around pretty much everywhere.

BackstoryDef.title: Former Junkie
BackstoryDef.description: There are many different chems in the wasteland, and [PAWN_nameDef] tried most of them at least once. For many years, [PAWN_pronoun] was a junkie, stealing, deceiving and cheating to earn money for the next dose of whatever obnoxious substance [PAWN_pronoun] was hooked on that time. Eventually, [PAWN_nameDef] managed to become clean and move on to begin a new life somewhere else. The long-lasting consumption of dangerous substances did take its toll on [PAWN_possessive] body, however, permanently damaging [PAWN_possessive] kidneys.

BackstoryDef.title: Drifting Musician
BackstoryDef.description: After taking a few jobs here and there, [PAWN_nameDef] decided that a settled life wasn’t the right thing for [PAWN_objective]. Instead, [PAWN_pronoun] hit the road and faced the wasteland with nothing but the clothes on [PAWN_possessive] back and [PAWN_possessive] trusty guitar, wandering from town to town without a clear goal or destination in mind.

BackstoryDef.title: Militia Member
BackstoryDef.description: Regardless of the many larger and well-known political entities and groups which thrived throughout the wasteland, the majority of the humans living in post-war America were part of smaller, more or less independent settlements and groups. Most of these communities didn’t have the means and manpower to operate a standing army and relied on voluntary militias to defend them from outside threats. [PAWN_nameDef] was part of such a militia. Despite the fact that [PAWN_pronoun] never got any real combat training and needed to procure [PAWN_possessive] own equipment, [PAWN_nameDef] was proud to serve a good cause.

BackstoryDef.title: Former Tribal
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] spent much of [PAWN_possessive] adult life in a tribal-like society. One day [PAWN_pronoun] broke off from [PAWN_possessive] group to explore the world beyond the small tribal homelands. After visiting many different “civilized” settlements in the wasteland [PAWN_nameDef] decided to settle down in a quaint little village. While [PAWN_pronoun] managed to adapt to [PAWN_possessive] new surroundings relatively well, [PAWN_pronoun] remained sceptical towards high-tech technology.

BackstoryDef.title: Radio Presenter
BackstoryDef.description: There were a stunning number of different radio stations throughout the wasteland, albeit most of them had a limited range of reception. [PAWN_nameDef] was the host of one of these radio stations and fulfilled both the role of DJ and news reporter. [PAWN_pronoun] was extremely popular among the comparatively few people who managed to get [PAWN_possessive] radio signal, due to [PAWN_possessive] excellent choice in music. However, [PAWN_nameDef] never got much experience with manual labour.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Butcher
BackstoryDef.description: Like [PAWN_possessive] father, [PAWN_nameDef] became a butcher. The vast majority of people in the post-apocalyptic wasteland couldn’t be picky in their choice of food and [PAWN_nameDef] couldn’t be picky what to butcher and sell to [PAWN_possessive] customers either. Radroaches, molerats, squirrels, bloatflies and iguanas were the among the more affordable foodstuffs. Brahmin and bighorner meats were usually reserved for those with a refined palate. And the necessary caps of course.

BackstoryDef.title: Wandering Priest
BackstoryDef.description: Although most people in the wasteland didn’t have the luxury of free time to ask themselves existential or theological questions, there were exceptions. [PAWN_nameDef] was a wandering priest, traveling from town to town. [PAWN_possessive] goal never was to convert the people of the wasteland to a specific faith, but to give them hope thru giving them something to believe in. [PAWN_nameDef] never got a proper theological education and pasted [PAWN_possessive] faith together from various scriptures [PAWN_pronoun] found in old churches and other temples.

BackstoryDef.title: Children of Atom Preacher
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was part of the comparatively young but rapidly PlantWork cult called “The Children of Atom”. This cult worshipped a deity named Atom, and revered radiation and nuclear annihilation as manifestations of their god’s will. They believed, that within every atomic mass in all of creation existed an entire universe and nuclear fission was a divine act of creating new life. [PAWN_nameDef] became part of this cult while [PAWN_pronoun] was searching for meaning in the brutal, unforgiving world that came to be after the great war. Unfortunately for [PAWN_objective] not all wastelanders looked favourably upon such… innovative ideas.

BackstoryDef.title: Post-war Undertaker
BackstoryDef.description: Life in the wasteland was often brutal, arduous and short. Some of the larger settlements employed an undertaker. [PAWN_nameDef] was one of those undertakers and [PAWN_possessive] job was to dig graves and bury those whose lives were claimed by raiders, radiation, mutated beasts and, occasionally, old age.

BackstoryDef.title: Water Purifier Worker
BackstoryDef.description: Since clean water was precious in most parts of the wasteland, water purifiers often decided over the live and death of a settlement. Due to [PAWN_possessive] moderate understanding of this incredibly important machine, [PAWN_nameDef] was assigned to look after it. To do that properly [PAWN_pronoun] often had to improvise while repairing the water purifier, as the old machine was prone to malfunctions and spare parts were rare.

BackstoryDef.title: Solar Panel Expert
BackstoryDef.description: Usually only the larger settlements were hooked up to a power network, the smaller ones had to help themselves, if they wanted electricity. Pre-war solar arrays were a preferred choice, as they usually generated enough power for a small settlement and were comparatively easy to maintain and repair due to their rugged design. [PAWN_nameDef] was in charge of [PAWN_possessive] settlement’s solar arrays, a job [PAWN_pronoun] took very seriously.

BackstoryDef.title: Roadside Merchant
BackstoryDef.description: Instead of taking the risk of traveling through the wasteland with [PAWN_possessive] wares, [PAWN_nameDef] decided it would be much safer to put up a roadside shop to deal with incoming caravans and travellers. [PAWN_pronoun] managed to get by, but was always wary of raiders, since [PAWN_possessive] business depended on safe roads to travel on.

BackstoryDef.title: Enclave Patriot
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a loyal member of the Enclave, a remnant of the pre-war United States government. [PAWN_pronoun] believed in the Enclave's mission to restore America to its former glory, even if it meant using ruthless methods. [PAWN_pronoun] was trained in advanced combat and technology, making [PAWN_objective] a formidable opponent in the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Bounty Hunter
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] took on the dangerous profession of hunting criminals in a largely lawless world. The transition between bounty hunter and mercenary was often smooth and unclear, but [PAWN_pronoun] to think of [PAWN_objective]self as a bringer of law, judge, jury and executioner.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Teacher
BackstoryDef.description: In a world were few had the time and means to educate themselves, [PAWN_nameDef] took it upon [PAWN_objective]self to teach the children of [PAWN_possessive] community how to write, read and count as well as anything else [PAWN_pronoun] could find old books about. History, however, was a subject [PAWN_nameDef] avoided, too little did [PAWN_pronoun] know about it and too depressing were the few scraps of knowledge [PAWN_pronoun] managed to paste together.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Quack
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] wasn’t among the most honest people wandering around the wasteland. [PAWN_pronoun] made a living traveling from one backwater settlement to the text, selling elixirs and concoctions of wondrous qualities, or so [PAWN_pronoun] claimed… It was quite important that [PAWN_pronoun already left a settlement before its inhabitants caught on to the scheme.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Hooker
BackstoryDef.description: Unlike other aspects of life before the great war, like sanitation or education, prostitution remained a staple of post-war economy. [PAWN_nameDef] didn’t chose [PAWN_possessive] profession out of desire, but out of need, as it proved to be a comparatively easy way to get by. Sure, [PAWN_pronoun] had to deal with stingy and intrusive costumers every once in a while, but it surely beat scrounging around in some ghoul-infested ruins for supplies, at least for [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Post-war Bodyguard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] made a living by protecting affluent customers from the dangers of the wasteland. [PAWN_pronoun] protected wealthy caravaners, important officials from everything and everyone that would harm them, as long as they paid of course. While it may have been less lethal than working as a mercenary, it was still dangerous and [PAWN_nameDef] had the scars to prove it.

BackstoryDef.title: Wasteland Mayor
BackstoryDef.description: While most smaller settlements in the wasteland were ruled over by the town’s sheriff, some of the larger one’s had a mayor, who may or may not have been elected democratically. [PAWN_nameDef] was one of those mayors and while [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed the benefits of the office, [PAWN_pronoun] deeply cared for the members of [PAWN_possessive] community.

BackstoryDef.title: Daring Explorer
BackstoryDef.description: The wasteland was, without question, an extremely dangerous place. However, many Adventurers like [PAWN_nameDef] dared to explore the ruins of the past. Partially out of curiosity, partially for the profit that could be made. Many ruins of the old world lured with treasures and [PAWN_pronoun] was determined to answer their call.

BackstoryDef.title: Holodisk Librarian
BackstoryDef.description: As the old world burned in the fires of nuclear devastation, most of the knowledge humanity gathered over the centuries was lost forever. One of the few relatively reliable sources of knowledge were holodisks, which proved to be resilient enough not only to survive the great war, but many decades of nuclear fallout too. [PAWN_nameDef] made it [PAWN_possessive] life goal to gather and preserve as much of the once lost knowledge of the world before the war. [PAWN_pronoun] preferred to leave the dangerous work of obtaining the disks to mercs and spent most of [PAWN_possessive] time analysing and cataloguing the contents of dusty holodisks.

BackstoryDef.title: Pre-war Gourmet
BackstoryDef.description: Just the thought of eating radroaches or molerats made [PAWN_nameDef] shiver with disgust. [PAWN_pronoun] was what some called an old-world gourmet and preferred to dine on ancient rations of canned meat, mac and cheese and Salisbury steak. While most members of [PAWN_possessive] community only shook their heads at [PAWN_possessive] behaviour, none could argue that [PAWN_pronoun] was indeed a good cook.

BackstoryDef.title: Diner Chef
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] operated a small diner next to a road bustling with trade. [PAWN_pronoun] was happy to provide a warm meal and a place to sleep to any paying customers, as long as they didn’t start any trouble.

BackstoryDef.title: Brotherhood Deserter
BackstoryDef.description: The strict and military lifestyle of the Brotherhood wasn’t for everyone. While [PAWN_nameDef] was born into the Brotherhood of Steel, it didn’t take [PAWN_objective] long to realise that this kind of life just wasn’t for [PAWN_objective]. One night, while on guard duty, [PAWN_pronoun] left [PAWN_possessive] post to never return. [PAWN_nameDef] had some troubles adapting to a “civilian” life, but [PAWN_pronoun] had to keep a low profile and hope that [PAWN_possessive] former brothers and sisters wouldn’t catch [PAWN_objective]. Desertion wasn’t taken lightly by the Brotherhood of Steel.

BackstoryDef.title: Implant Expert
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the few remaining experts on performance enhancing implants left in the world. This made [PAWN_objective] an incredibly valuable asset for [PAWN_possessive] community. However, no one really knew where [PAWN_pronoun] obtained [PAWN_possessive] knowledge about the almost lost art of cybernetic enhancements. [PAWN_nameDef] never really talked about [PAWN_possessive] past.

BackstoryDef.title: Co-op Gardener
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a gardener in a cooperative agricultural project. [PAWN_pronoun] and his fellow co-op members tended to a communal garden and evenly split the yield. While it was tedious work, the harvest was usually enough to not only feed all the members, but to sell the surplus on a nearby market.

BackstoryDef.title: Greaser
BackstoryDef.description: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] once found pre-war magazines about the greaser culture and old holodisks with rock music. This proved to be quite the formative experience, as [PAWN_pronoun] never left this phase behind and continued to live [PAWN_possessive] life the greaser way. Keep it cool, Daddy-O!

BackstoryDef.title: Orphaned Wanderer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] parents were killed by raiders when [PAWN_pronoun] was still a child. Leaving [PAWN_possessive] all alone in the world. Despite the odds, [PAWN_pronoun] managed to grow into adulthood. The wasteland is a harsh and unforgiving place, and few have internalized its lessons as well as [PAWN_nameDef].

BackstoryDef.title: Child Entrepreneur
BackstoryDef.description: From a very young age, [PAWN_nameDef] has had an entrepreneurial spirit, collecting scrap and knick-knacks and either selling or exchanging whatever [PAWN_pronoun] could find with others.

BackstoryDef.title: Curious Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a very curious child. [PAWN_pronoun] was fascinated with every aspect of the vast wasteland, perhaps more so than was good for [PAWN_objective]. While this curiosity often put [PAWN_nameDef] into dangerous situations, it provided [PAWN_objective] with precious knowledge about the creatures of the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Bully
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was always a little taller and stronger than [PAWN_possessive] peers, a useful trait in the unforgiving wasteland. [PAWN_pronoun] used [PAWN_possessive] impressive stature to boss around others and take whatever [PAWN_possessive] wanted. Unfortunately, [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t among the brightest and most gifted children.

BackstoryDef.title: Apprentice
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] has been adopted by a skilled craftsman and started to learn [PAWN_possessive] trade from a young age. However, [PAWN_pronoun] never finished [PAWN_possessive] apprenticeship, as [PAWN_pronoun] started to travel the world and roam from town to town, despite the dangers of the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: BB Gun Crack shot
BackstoryDef.description: As a child [PAWN_nameDef] found an old but functional BB Gun. [PAWN_pronoun] often practiced shooting for many hours and became a capable Shot, a skill most valuable in the hostile wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Ruin Dweller
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a ruined pre-war building somewhere in the vast wasteland. [PAWN_pronoun] had to constantly clear away rubble and debris to create more space for living. However, the constant danger of collapsing roofs made [PAWN_objective] nervous and shaky, impairing [PAWN_possessive] fine motor skills.

BackstoryDef.title: Gas Station Inhabitant
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up around a reinforced gas station. While it may not have been the most glamorous accommodation, the station was secure enough to grant [PAWN_objective] an unharmed childhood and [PAWN_pronoun] learned a thing or two about the old world from the advertising posters and brochures.

BackstoryDef.title: Caravan Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on the road. [PAWN_pronoun] grew up with a caravan travelling from settlement to settlement. From a very young age [PAWN_nameDef] learned the art of bartering and looking after the caravan’s brahmin.

BackstoryDef.title: Street Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born and raised on the streets of a settlement somewhere in the wasteland. From a very young age [PAWN_pronoun] had to take care of [PAWN_objective]self and the fact [PAWN_pronoun] made it to adulthood at all showed [PAWN_possessive ] tenacity.

BackstoryDef.title: Cannibalistic Youth
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into a community of cannibals. As [PAWN_nameDef] was used to this unsavoury diet from a young age, it took a long time until [PAWN_pronoun] recognized the depraved nature of [PAWN_possessive] community. Once [PAWN_pronoun] realized it, [PAWN_pronoun] quickly left the group. [PAWN_nameDef] was haunted by [PAWN_possessive] past and had troubles interacting with other people.

BackstoryDef.title: Cryostasis Child
BackstoryDef.description: The day the bombs fell, a selected few were put into cryostasis chambers and survived the following nuclear apocalypse unharmed. [PAWN_nameDef] was one of these people who endured the decades and centuries in cryostasis. While [PAWN_pronoun] had many skills, which were rare in the postapocalyptic wasteland, [PAWN_pronoun] also knew little to nothing about the societies which have emerged since the Great War.

BackstoryDef.title: Wild Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up alone in the wilds. [PAWN_possessive] only companions were animals and [PAWN_pronoun] never learned to write and read. While [PAWN_pronoun] was in contact with other humans since [PAWN_possessive] time in the wilds, [PAWN_pronoun] still has no social skills whatsoever, but few inhabitants of the wasteland knew so much about survival in the wilderness as [PAWN_pronoun] did.

BackstoryDef.title: Stung by Radscorpion
BackstoryDef.description: While playing in the wastes as a child, [PAWN_nameDef] was attacked and stung by a radscorpion. While [PAWN_pronoun] managed to survive both the attack itself and the poison injected into [PAWN_objective], [PAWN_pronoun] remained weakened for a long time. At least [PAWN_pronoun] learned a lot about animals and medicine during this painful experience.

BackstoryDef.title: Eco-Cultist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was raised by a devoted cult. The cult aimed to form the largely barren wasteland into a paradise of green splendour. To further this goal all cultists were experts in tending to plants and animals. However, the cult was far from pacifistic, as the green patches the members cared for attracted a great number of scavengers, bot humans and beasts. Thus, [PAWN_nameDef] learned both gardening and herding as weel as fighting when [PAWN_pronoun] was young.

BackstoryDef.title: Whorehouse Kid
BackstoryDef.description: Prostitution proved to be not only one of the oldest businesses of humanity, but also one of the most resilient. The practice survived the apocalypse and thrived in the wasteland. [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the surroundings of a brothel. While this upbringing might have been dubious in nature, it was also relatively safe, as brothels and whorehouses were usually well guarded and defended. [PAWN_pronoun] learned a lot about human nature and their interactions with each other while observing the clients.

BackstoryDef.title: Gambler’s Kid
BackstoryDef.description: As a child of a passionate gambler [PAWN_nameDef] was used to a roving lifestyle, as [PAWN_possessive] parents often changed their place of residence. Usually, the family stayed in the same place as long as there were casinos or people to exploit and hastened off quickly as soon as the victims grew angry enough to resort to violence. While [PAWN_nameDef] never was much of a book learner, [PAWN_pronoun] was cunning and sly.

BackstoryDef.title: Child Sheriff
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a settlement where only children lived. The other kids looked up to [PAWN_objective], both figurately and literally, as [PAWN_pronoun] was one of the oldest children. Therefore, it was [PAWN_possessive] duty to ensure the safety of the town’s inhabitants. After [PAWN_pronoun] reached a certain age [PAWN_pronoun] had to, like it was custom, leave the town and make a living someplace else.

BackstoryDef.title: Surviving Mormon
BackstoryDef.description: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the few survivors of the sacking of New Canaan. The Canaanites, as they were often called by outsiders, were known as skilled crafters and honest traders who knew how to defend themselves. However, after [PAWN_pronoun] witnessed the slaughter of [PAWN_possessive] people [PAWN_nameDef] vowed to never take up arms again.

BackstoryDef.title: Advanced Student
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was fortunate enough to receive an advanced education while [PAWN_pronoun] was a child. Thise made [PAWN_objective] somewhat of an oddity among the unwashed and illiterate masses of the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Livestock Herder
BackstoryDef.description: Like many others, [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] family made a living through a small herd of cattle, mostly brahmin they herded. While this may not have been the most exciting childhood, [PAWN_nameDef] rarely had to go hungry for an extended period of time.

BackstoryDef.title: Nomad Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up as part of a nomadic clan, which followed around herds of semi-domesticated cattle. While [PAWN_nameDef] learned a lot about living off the land, [PAWN_pronoun] never lived within a major settlement and had lacked many skills the city folk was known for.

BackstoryDef.title: Abducted by Aliens
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] claimed to have been abducted by aliens while [PAWN_pronoun] was a child. Of course, [PAWN_pronoun] never managed to come up with actual proof of this tall tale, but [PAWN_possessive] startling descriptions of the aliens called zetans and their malevolent experimentation on humans made sure most other people preferred to keep their distance from [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Swamp Dweller
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a reclusive community located in a nearly impassable swamp area. The manifold dangers of the swamp, mostly pockets of toxic or radioactive mist and the monsters that lurked within them, ensured only the hardiest people survived to adulthoodac. [PAWN_nameDef] had to fight the horrors of the swamp from a young age but had little time for education or creative activities.

BackstoryDef.title: Pit Refugee
BackstoryDef.description: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] fled from the area known as the pit. The pit was a, even by the standards of the wasteland, nightmarish industrial landscape, where only the most abhorrent creatures could survive. On top of that the area was ruled over by a band of bloodthirsty raiders who enslaved the local population forced them to toil around blast furnaces to smelt precious metal night and day. No wonder, [PAWN_nameDef] fled.

BackstoryDef.title: Greenhorn
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on a remote farmstead. Early on in [PAWN_possessive] youth, [PAWN_pronoun] began to dream about a life far away from the dull and demanding farm work. Soon after, [PAWN_nameDef] set out to make it in the big city.

BackstoryDef.title: Megaton Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born within Megaton, one of the largest settlements within the capital wasteland. While the city was relatively safe from outside threats such as raiders and mutated wildlife, the dormant atomic warhead located at the heart of the settlement posed a significant threat itself. However, like most of Megaton’s inhabitants, [PAWN_nameDef] got used to the ghastly landmark.

BackstoryDef.title: Rivet City Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born and raised in Rivet City in the capital wasteland. Rivet City was a town located deep within the belly of a stranded aircraft carrier which made it one of the safest settlements the known wasteland. [PAWN_nameDef] grew up enjoying significantly more safety and security than most children, which in turn led to underdeveloped combat skills.

BackstoryDef.title: Children of Atom Novice
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born to a couple of cultists of the Children of Atom. This bizarre cult revered a deity called Atom and thought that an atomic explosion was the holy act of their deity to create new life. Naturally, most wastelanders frowned upon, or outright despised the cult, as they knew the perils of radiation all too well.

BackstoryDef.title: Diamond City Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the “green jewel” of the commonwealth wasteland, Diamon City. Protected by the near impenetrable walls of the largest settlement in the commonwealth, [PAWN_nameDef] enjoyed a relatively safe and happy childhood, visiting the local school and spending [PAWN_possessive] free time practicing hitting things with [PAWN_possessive] trusty baseball bat.

BackstoryDef.title: Novac Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born and raised in Novac, one of the smaller settlements of the Mojave wasteland. While Novac did not have the mighty walls of New Vegas, nor the raw military power of the NCR to count on, its watchful citizens still made it one of the safer places to live. Plus, there were dinosaur souvenirs.

BackstoryDef.title: Westside Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] has seen things no child should see during [PAWN_possessive] upbringing in the outer districts of New Vegas. Westside always was a cesspool of vice and violence and unlike many others [PAWN_nameDef] survived long enough to get out of it, albeit it left its marks on [PAWN_objective]. [PAWN_pronoun] learned a thing or two from the local gang, the Kings.

BackstoryDef.title: Goodsprings Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in Goodsprings, in the Mojave wasteland, aptly named so for its relative abundance of clean drinking water. While Goodsprings wasn’t really well defended, its remote location ensured that few dangers threatened the town. This lack of excitement (or mortal dangers, depending on perspective) was too dull for [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_pronoun] decided to leave as soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was coming of age.

BackstoryDef.title: Trapper Offspring
BackstoryDef.description: While most of the remaining wildlife of the wasteland was extremely dangerous, not to mention irradiated, the general scarcity of foodstuffs ensured that their meat was in high demand. [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents made a living from trapping various smaller animals with shoddy contraptions, a trade which was rightfully viewed as a less dangerous method than hunting.

BackstoryDef.title: Primm Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the city of Primm, a settlement south of New Vegas. While the town did have casinos of its own, it never managed to reach the glamour of the New Vegas strip. Still, the occasional caravan and gambler on the way to the strip ensured the town’s moderate wealth.

BackstoryDef.title: Tribal Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into one of the numerous tribal societies which have emerged in the wasteland. What the tribe lacked in terms of technology and organisation it made up for in ingenuity and adaptability. These traits ensured, that the tribe managed to eke out a living where others would have perished.

BackstoryDef.title: Gunslinger Juvie
BackstoryDef.description: In [PAWN_possessive] youth [PAWN_nameDef] found an old revolver while scavenging in some ruins. Inspired by tales of the gunslingers of the old world, [PAWN_pronoun] took up the iron and began practicing.

BackstoryDef.title: Frontier Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born on the very frontier of human civilisation, such as it is. Thanks to its remoteness, the region was relatively free of radiation and the absence of larger settlements or trade routes made it unpopular for raiders. However, this also meant that everything had to be built from scratch, since there were little to no ruins to scavenge.

BackstoryDef.title: Displaced Child
BackstoryDef.description: War and strife were commonplace, even after the apocalypse. [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] family were refugees, fleeing from one of the countless conflicts that arose in the wasteland.

BackstoryDef.title: Born Miner
BackstoryDef.description: While most of the earth’s natural resources were depleted before the great war, there still were a few mines in operation in the wasteland. The scarcity of raw materials ensured, that these mines were of great strategic value for whoever was in control of them. [PAWN_nameDef] was born in the vicinity of one of those last mines and spent much of [PAWN_possessive] youth digging for ore.

BackstoryDef.title: Apothecary’s Apprentice
BackstoryDef.description: In [PAWN_possessive] youth, [PAWN_nameDef] worked for a local pharmacist as an assistant. While the remedies they produced were much less effective compared to a stimpak or other pre-war medicine, the overall lack of medical supplies in the wasteland, paired with the numerous dangers that lurked within it ensured that they never lacked customers.

BackstoryDef.title: Entitled Youth
BackstoryDef.description: Through some means, probably illegal or unsavoury in nature, [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents became wealthy enough to afford a lifestyle most wastelanders only could dream about. [PAWN_pronoun] enjoyed an above average education and luxuries most others would have deemed lavish. This also meant, that [PAWN_pronoun] never had to care for [PAWN_objective]self and abhors the thought of doing tasks which [PAWN_pronoun] deemed beneath [PAWN_objective]self.

BackstoryDef.title: Drug Courier
BackstoryDef.description: During [PAWN_possessive] youth, [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a drug courier for a syndicate of the local organised crime. The drug dealers used the fact that children are mostly left alone and rarely under the superstition of transporting illegal or highly valuable goods. While this certainly was not the best upbringing a child could hope for, [PAWN_nameDef] learned valuable skills during this time.

BackstoryDef.title: Junior Mechanic
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up around a shop operated by a group of mechanics. They quickly realized how gifted [PAWN_nameDef] was and took [PAWN_objective] in. [PAWN_pronoun] learned a lot about the miracle work of the mechanics namely, how to keep machinery in an operational state without a reliable source of spare parts.

BackstoryDef.title: Little Lamplight Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in the hidden settlement of Little Lamplight, deep within the capital wasteland. Only children were allowed to life in this peculiar settlement, as everyone had to leave after they reached the age of sixteen. [PAWN_nameDef] learned a lot about plant care during [PAWN_possessive] time in Little Lamplight, as the townspeople mainly ate mushrooms that grew in the cave it was located in.

BackstoryDef.title: Goodneighbour Juvie
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born and raised in the settlement of Goodneighbour in the commonwealth. The town was rough and [PAWN_nameDef] had to learn early in life who [PAWN_pronoun] could trust to avoid getting shanked. It was a tough youth, but it made [PAWN_objective] even tougher.

BackstoryDef.title: Shopkeeper’s Child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born as the child of shopkeepers. Early on [PAWN_pronoun] learned about trade and bartering. Since the small settlement, their shop was located in had no security forces to speak off, [PAWN_pronoun] too had to learn how to scare of thieves and other rascals.

BackstoryDef.title: Aspiring Treasure Hunter
BackstoryDef.description: As a child, [PAWN_nameDef] fled from the area known as the pit. The pit was a, even by the standards of the wasteland, nightmarish industrial landscape, where only the most abhorrent creatures could survive. On top of that the area was ruled over by a band of bloodthirsty raiders who enslaved the local population forced them to toil around blast furnaces to smelt precious metal night and day. No wonder, [PAWN_nameDef] fled.

BackstoryDef.title: Merc’s Kid
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born as the child of a wasteland mercenary. While [PAWN_possessive] parent trade ensured [PAWN_nameDef] rarely had to go hungry for an extended period of time, [PAWN_pronoun] was well aware that the dangers of the merc life could very well leave [PAWN_objective] orphaned. Despite this, [PAWN_nameDef] took after [PAWN_possessive] parent and started to fire, clean, and modify all the guns [PAWN_pronoun] could get [PAWN_possessive] hands on.
